claim.text: MarS is the first system to leverage core elements of financial markets for a wide range of downstream applications
claim.exact_quote: Among the broad adoption of AI techniques in finance, MarS is the first to fully leverage the core elements of financial markets, making it a powerful tool for a wide range of downstream applications.

conclusion.limitations: No clear evidence provided comparing to other systems or demonstrating uniqueness of approach

claim.text: LMM shows strong scalability across data size and model complexity
claim.exact_quote: Key observations include LMM's strong scalability across data size and model complexity, and MarS's robust and practicable realism in controlled generation with market impact.

evidence.evidence_text: Scaling curves show improved performance with increased data and model sizes for both Order Model and Order-Batch Model
evidence.limitations: Maximum sizes tested were 32B tokens/1B parameters for Order Model and 10B tokens/3B parameters for Order-Batch Model
evidence.exact_quote: Our findings indicate that as the size of the data and the model increases, LMM's performance improves significantly, consistent with the scaling laws observed in other foundation models.

conclusion.limitations: Scaling curves only shown for two components, absolute performance metrics not provided

claim.text: MarS achieves robust and practicable realism in controlled generation with market impact
claim.exact_quote: Key observations include LMM's strong scalability across data size and model complexity, and MarS's robust and practicable realism in controlled generation with market impact.

evidence.evidence_text: Market impact validation shows adherence to Square-Root-Law
evidence.limitations: Only validated against one established market impact law
evidence.exact_quote: We validated these simulations by collecting market impacts from agents with various configurations, confirming that the synthetic data adheres to the Square-Root-Law

conclusion.limitations: Only one market impact law validated, limited real-world comparison

claim.text: LMM scales effectively with increasing data and model size
claim.exact_quote: By leveraging structured market data, LMM scales effectively with increasing data and model size, as we will demonstrate through scaling law evaluation, revealing its potential for handling large-scale financial markets.

conclusion.limitations: No specific evidence provided beyond what's covered in claim 2

claim.text: MarS successfully replicates key stylized facts from historical market data
claim.exact_quote: MarS successfully replicates these stylized facts, demonstrating its capability to produce highly realistic market simulations suitable for practical applications.

evidence.evidence_text: Experimental results showing MarS replicates three key stylized facts from historical data
evidence.limitations: Only three stylized facts shown in main paper, though claims eleven total in appendix
evidence.exact_quote: MarS successfully replicates these stylized facts, demonstrating its capability to produce highly realistic market simulations suitable for practical applications.

conclusion.limitations: Only three stylized facts shown, may not represent full market complexity

claim.text: MarS is the first to build a financial world simulator using foundation models
claim.exact_quote: To the best of our knowledge, we are the first to build a financial world simulator.

evidence.evidence_text: Direct statement of being first financial world simulator
evidence.limitations: Claim made in related work discussion without direct comparison evidence
evidence.exact_quote: To the best of our knowledge, we are the first to build a financial world simulator.

conclusion.limitations: No evidence comparing to other potential financial simulators using foundation models

claim.text: LMM is the first to reveal scaling laws on trading orders
claim.exact_quote: We propose a Large Market Model (LMM), which, for the first time, reveals the scaling law on trading orders.

conclusion.limitations: No evidence provided demonstrating novelty or comparing to prior work on trading order scaling
